definitions: in a way that creates a thin piece or layer of something

examples.text: thinly spread mustard over the meat
a board covered thinly with flour

shortDefinitions: in way that creates a thin piece or layer of something

definitions: with little flesh or fat on the body

examples.text: he was tall and thinly built

shortDefinitions: with little flesh or fat on body

definitions: with few parts or people relative to the area covered or filled; sparsely

examples.text: people were thinly spread throughout the square

shortDefinitions: with few parts or members relative to area

definitions: in a way that lacks strength, substance, or quality; weakly

examples.text: the sun shines only thinly through a veil of water
a mishmash of thinly sketched characters

shortDefinitions: in a way that lacks strength, substance, or quality

definitions: in a weak and forced manner
